sense.name: an artistic composition, opus, e.g., painting
sense.examples: John sold two of his pictures of seascapes in oil to a local gallery. This picture by Degas fetched several million at an art house auction.

sense.name: a photograph or snapshot
sense.examples: Mary takes pictures with both her digital camera and her 35 mm camera. They haven't yet gotten back their pictures from the wedding. I took a picture of Pete in front of the Eiffel Tower.

sense.name: a film or movie
sense.examples: Sally is taking the kids to the pictures this afternoon. The picture stars a relatively unknown young Italian actor. They are shooting the picture on location.

sense.name: illustration, often published
sense.examples: I got the idea from a picture in Architectural Digest. This dictionary provides a lot of pictures to illustrate the definitions of nouns.

sense.name: a mental impression, mental image
sense.commentary: PICTURE[+state][+mental][+impression] Note: does not imply communication to others (See Sense 7)
sense.examples: Her picture of how the resort would look was quite different than the reality of it. John was motivated by a picture of himself as a wheeler and dealer in Silicon Valley. I cannot form a clear picture of his face from memory.

sense.name: transmitted TV signal
sense.examples: We just lost the picture, but the audio is still coming through. Try adjusting the controls to sharpen the picture on the TV.

sense.name: a verbal depiction or characterization
sense.commentary: PICTURE[+activity][+communication][+characterization][+depiction] Note: implies an agent who provides the picture, X's picture of Y (in contrast to sense 8)
sense.examples: The author provided a fascinating picture of life in 19th-century Polynesia. His picture of the next two financial quarters is fairly grim.

sense.name: a social circumstance or situation
sense.commentary: PICTURE[+state][+social][+circumstances][+surrounding] Note: picture is the context, -not- an agent's portrayal of it (Sense 7)
sense.examples: John asked Mary if he were still in the picture. (part of her life) I think they are losing site of the big picture here. The economic picture of those nations is currently not favorable. He is pretty much out of the picture now as a serious presidential condidate.

sense.name: a perfect example, epitome
sense.examples: He is the picture of youthful exuberance. Their faces were the picture of dispair.
